intro: Callista cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pinkish flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Callista cuspidata is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in well-drained, acidic soils.
